summary:
Irrigation and Rural Engineer with a Masters degree in Civil Engineering with 43 years of professional experience in international assignments in the field of integrated water management development in agriculture including irrigation, water storage, and flood protection all around the world and especially in Africa. 

Proven track record for direction, management and coordination of large multi-disciplinary teams and in charge of project management of major feasibility and detailed design studies as well as master planning, responsible for planning and evaluation of projects and programs financed by German Financial Cooperation and other international development institutions. Working experience in 24 African countries, including five long-term assignments in Kenya and numerous others in Southern, East and West Africa. 

Broad experience in preparation of master plans, pre-feasibility and feasibility studies and design of irrigation systems with state of the art modelling software including staff training. Experienced in dealing with water user associations. Although trained as Civil and Irrigation Engineer, he strongly advocates to include in all studies appropriate attention to socio-economic and environmental issues incl. environmental screening and scoping of rural engineering projects. Many expert missions were undertaken for a large number of Clients for preparation, formulation, appraisal, review, and evaluation of projects and programs as well as for supervision of their implementation, systems operation and maintenance.

Experienced in preparing feasibility studies and design for small hydropower schemes, flood control and flood protection works,  water harvesting and erosion control, rural roads and small dams, and rural drinking water supplies.

profile_positions.description:
Prefeasibility study of 10,000ha range land to define options for development of  irrigated agriculture around St Phillips in the lowveld sugar cane area. 
Evaluation of preliminary soil and land suitability studies carried out by SWADE; calculation of water requirements for a number of food and industrial crops; formulation of options for conveyance and storage of  water, preparation of preliminary CAPEX estimate for conveyance, storage, distribution, and on farm irrigation systems, including diversion weir, large diameter inverted siphon, lined canals, pump stations, centre pivot, and buried drip lines, as well as power supply systems; and formulation of terms of references for short studies on soil and land suitability, catchment yield, and geotechnical suitability at a site for a storage dam.

profile_positions.description:
LUSIP II Smallholder Irrigated Sugarcane Project, Swaziland (SWADE). Feasibility and detailed design studies (6,000 ha). 
Leading a team of 27 international and national specialists and supervising its work including detailed soil and land suitability studies; topographical and geotechnical studies; updating of hydrological information and assessment of available water resources; preparation of lay-outs of irrigation and drainage systems; design of irrigation and drainage systems, including associated structures, pipe distribution systems and localized irrigation, with emphasis on centre pivot; water supply and sanitation feasibility studies and designs; EIA and mitigation studies; financial and economic assessment studies
profile_positions.title: Team Leader

profile_positions.description:
HGF Multipurpose Dam on Tana River, Kenya (MORDA). Feasibility study of the HGF multipurpose dam with downstream irrigation development. 

PHASE 1: FEASIBILITY STUDY RESETTLEMENT SCHEME AND PREFEASIBILITY STUDIES DOWNSTREAM DEVELOPMENT
Leading a team of 5 national specialists (one agronomist, one soil specialist, three irrigation/civil engineers) for identification of potential areas for medium-/ large-scale irrigation development, gravity and pumped supply, incl. transfer schemes; soil and land suitability and topographic studies; Pre-/feasibility studies for public and privately financed projects for food and industrial crops mainly under drip and sprinkler irrigation (60,000 ha); preparation of cost estimates; assessment of impact of dam on irrigation development in Tana floodplain and Tana delta

PHASE 2: DETAILED DESIGNS
Detailed design ofd two rrigation schemes (4,500ha resettlement area and 10,500ha public/privately financed) downstream of the multipurpose dam. Leading a team of 20 international and national specialists for preparation of topographic maps for detailed design; detailed soil and land suitability studies; preparation of lay-outs of irrigation and drainage systems; agricultural, livestock, socio-economic and resettlement studies; design of irrigation/drainage systems incl. associated structures, pump stations and pipe distribution systems; design of tertiary and on-field irrigation systems, comprising improved gravity, center pivots, sprinklers and drip systems; hydrological studies to determine capacities of cross drainage structures; civil engineering and structural designs, tender documents, bill of quantities and cost estimates
